title: Week 14
description: Putting it all together & next steps
contents:
This week, we’ll wrap up the course’s contents: looking back at what you’ve learned, and how it all fits together – and looking forward to the steps you can take from here.
Readings
Slides
Slides: Putting it all together & next steps – Tuesday Zoom (Apr 13)
Final project: Due
Final project: Progress report – due Tuesday, Apr 13
Final project: New
Final project: Student presentations – in class, week of Apr 20
Final project: Submission – due Friday, Apr 30

title: Week 13
contents:
This will be our final week with significant new content, and in it, we will be learning about Snakemake. Snakemake is a so-called Workflow Management System, a program that can help you create flexible and reproducible analysis pipelines.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Workflows and workflow tools – Tuesday Zoom (Apr 06)
Slides: Getting started with Snakemake – Tue/Thu Zoom
Slides: More advanced Snakemake tips and tricks – Thursday Zoom (Apr 08)
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 13
Bonus exercise: a Snakemake workflow with real data
Final project: new
Final project: progress report – due Tuesday, Apr 13

title: Week 12
contents:
This week, you will learn about using regular expressions in Python. Because of the second “instructional break” of the semester, we will only meet on Tuesday.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Regex – Tuesday Zoom (Mar 30)
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 12

title: Week 11
contents:
This week, you’ll learn about using NumPy and Pandas, two large and popular Python packages for data analysis, and BioPython, an ecosystem of packages to deal with DNA sequence data.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Numpy – Tuesday Zoom (Mar 23)
Slides: Pandas – Tuesday/Thursday Zoom
Slides: BioPython – Thursday Zoom (Mar 25)
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 11
Final project: due
Final project: proposal – due Tuesday, Mar 23

title: Week 10
contents:
This week, you will learn about several strategies for writing “good” code: code that is clear, modular, flexible, and easy to troubleshoot.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Modules, custom functions, and program structure – Tuesday Zoom (Mar 16)
Slides: Calling Python scripts, errors, and beyond the basics – Thursday Zoom (Mar 18)
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 10
Final project: new
Final project: proposal – due Tuesday, Mar 23

title: Week 09
description: Python: Control flow and working with files
contents:
This week, you will learn about control flow and working with files in Python.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Control flow (Zach) – Tuesday Zoom (Mar 9)
Slides: Working with files – Thursday Zoom (Mar 11)
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 9

title: Week 08
contents:
This is the first of five consecutive weeks focused entirely on Python, and we will start by seeing why Python is a useful language for biologists and by getting acquainted with Python basics.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Introduction to Python – Tuesday Zoom (Mar 2)
Slides: Python data structures – Thursday Zoom (Mar 4)
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 8

title: Week 07
contents:
In this half-module (we have no class on Tuesday), we will talk about downloading and transferring data in the shell, checking file integrity, and working with compressed data.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Part I – Data download, transfer and integrity
Slides: Part II – Shell productivity tips & scripting recap
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 7

title: Week 06
contents:
This week, you’ll learn about the Ohio Supercomputer Center (OSC), submitting shell scripts to OSC’s queue with SLURM, and managing software with Conda.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Part I – An introduction to using OSC – Tuesday Zoom (Feb 16)
Slides: Part II – SLURM jobs in practice – Thursday Zoom (Feb 18)
Graded assignments
Graded assignment for week 6 (Due Tuesday, Feb 23)
Ungraded assignments
Mid-course survey
Optional: SSH setup

title: Week 05
contents:
This week, you will learn how to package your shell commands into robust, easily rerunnable shell scripts.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Part I – Variables, loops, arrays, and conditionals – Tuesday Zoom (Feb 9)
Slides: Part II – Shell scripting – Thursday Zoom (Feb 11)
Bonus slides: find and xargs
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 5

title: Week 04
contents:
This week, we will continue learning about working in the Unix shell, with a focus on tools that are useful for working with text files with (large amounts of) data, such as grep, awk, and sed.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Part I – Unix data tools – Tuesday Zoom (Feb 2)
Slides: Part II – awk and sed – Thursday Zoom (Feb 4)
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 4

title: Week 03
contents:
This week, you will learn about the why and how of using Git version control for your projects, and sharing your code on GitHub.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Part I – Getting started with Git – Tue Zoom (Jan 26)
Slides: Part II – Remotes on GitHub, and branching & merging – Thu Zoom (Jan 28)
Bonus slides: Undoing changes and viewing the past
Ungraded assignments
Git setup & GitHub authentication
Graded assignments
Graded assignment I: Shell, Markdown and Git (Due Tue, Feb 2)

title: Week 02
contents:
This week, we’ll talk about some best practices for project organization and applying these in the Unix shell, documenting your project with Markdown files, and VS Code, the course’s text editor.
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Part I – Some best practices for project organization – Tuesday Zoom (Jan 19)
Slides: Part II - Markdown and VS Code – Tue/Thu Zoom
Slides: Part III - Managing files in the shell – Thursday Zoom (Jan 21)
Ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 2
Sign up for a GitHub account

title: Week 01
contents:
This week, you will get an introduction to and overview of the course (Tuesday session) and will learn the basics of working in a Unix shell environment (Thursday session).
Content overview and readings
Slides
Slides: Course intro – Tuesday Zoom (Jan 12)
Slides: Shell basics – Thursday Zoom (Jan 14)
Pre-course ungraded assignments
Read the Practical course information
Pre-course survey
Get access to the Ohio Supercomputer Center (OSC)
Week 1 ungraded assignments
Exercises for week 1
Optional: Local software installation
